newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani rupee ends down in kerb, seen stable.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani rupee ends down in kerb, seen stable.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee ended 0.02 down at 41.90 to the dollar in the kerb market on Wednesday amid higher buying of the U.S. currency before the Friday's budget for fiscal 1997/98 (July-June), dealers said.
The rupee is likely to open stable on Thursday, a dealer said.
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rupee rate, last changed on May 23, was 40.3900/40.5920 against the dollar.
The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed at 3.70 percent compared to the opening at 3.80 percent.
